bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 18, 1953

div1.p: Siler appreciates Hench's report on the Camp Lazear dedication and notes that the report will be of great value to the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 18, 1953
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
------
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 18, 1953
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your letter of November 9th relative to the
material concerning the dedication of Camp Lazear. We appreciate more
than we can tell you all the time that you have devoted and the interest
you have devoted to the preparation of the report concerning this dedi-
cation and it will be of very great value to the records of the Walter
Reed Memorial Association. I, of course, read with a great deal of
pleasure the informal report of the dedication which you sent to me some
time ago.

Needless to say, we are sorry that it will not happen that you will
be here in the East during this week as we always look forward with very
great pleasure to having you with us when we hold the annual meeting.
However, there is nothing special that requires consideration this year.

I am very glad to be able to report that Mrs. Kean, who returned to
her home some time ago, is gradually improving and she told Mrs. Siler
over the telephone a day or so ago that she is now able to go up and
down stairs. We are hoping that it will be possible for us to get over
to see her in the next few days.
With very best regards and best wishes for the holiday season,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Walter Reed
Memorial Association jfs k
